data.title: How did ancient Greek armies who employed slaves in battle manage to keep them from routing or betraying them?
data.meta_description:
Answer (1 of 3): Slaves serving with ancient Greek armies were usually auxiliaries, tasked with carrying packs, digging ditches, polishing armour and so on, but many were serving as psiloi, the lightly-armoured skirmishers of the era.
